Customer_DepositObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Customer_DepositObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Customer_DepositObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Reference to an existing Customer Deposit for update only purposes.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Financials_Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures the Comment for the Business Process.

description: Business Process Parameters provide the ability to auto-submit to the business process.

Customer_Deposit_Data.description: Customer Deposit ID. This is the Customer Deposit unique identifier.

Submit for Approval is a boolean flag indicating if the transaction is to be submitted or saved in draft mode. If this flag is set, the transaction will be submitted, otherwise the transaction is saved in draft.
Set to True to disable editing and canceling the Customer Payment inside the Workday Application. Customer Payment can only be updated from the web service is this is set.

CompanyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Customer_Deposit_Data.description: This is the company that tranasction is for. This is the reference id value of the company.

CurrencyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Customer_Deposit_Data.description: This is the reference id of currency of the transaction  If no currency is specified, Workday will first look to see if the payer/payee has a preferred currency and if not, currency will be populated with the company base currency.  If the company base currency is not allowed currency for payer/payee then transaction will not be able to be submitted for approval.
This is the Customer Deposit date. It must be greater than or equal to all included payment transaction dates.

Free form text for a Customer Deposit Reference Number
Control Total Amount for the Customer Deposit. Enter this amount to ensure it matches the sum of the payment amounts deposited.

Customer_Deposit_Data.description: Reference to 1 to many Customer Payments existing in Workday, to include in this deposit.

validation.validation: Credit Card, Direct Debit, and Direct Deposit payments cannot be included when submitting Customer Deposits.
One or more of the Customer Payments selected to deposit is already canceled. Only non-canceled payments can be deposited.
The Company for all Customer Payments specified must match the Company of the Customer Deposit.
One or more of the Cash Sales selected to deposit is in progress.  Only approved Cash Sales can be deposited.

Customer_Deposit_Data.description: The total amount for the customer deposit.  This value is read-only and will be ignored on the submit web service.

description: The Data element containing all Customer Deposit attributes.

validation.validation: The Payment Deposit Date must be greater than the Payment Date for all Payments selected.
validation.description: The Payment Deposit Date must be greater than the Payment Date for all Payments selected.

validation.validation: The sum of deposits selected does not equal the control total amount.
validation.description: The sum of deposits selected does not equal the control total amount.

validation.validation: Transaction Currency not accepted by selected Bank Account.
validation.description: Transaction Currency not accepted by selected Bank Account.

validation.validation: Bank Account is either not valid for Company or Currency, or is not enabled for Customer Payments.
validation.description: Bank Account is either not valid for Company or Currency, or is not enabled for Customer Payments.

validation.validation: Please select at least one payment to deposit.
validation.description: Please select at least one payment to deposit.

validation.validation: Customer Payments to be attached to this Deposit cannot already be included in another non-canceled Customer Deposit.
validation.description: Customer Payments to be attached to this Deposit cannot already be included in another non-canceled Customer Deposit.

validation.validation: The default worktag for unapplied and on-account payments: [partitonableByCompany] is not allowed for [company]. Ask your Finance Administrator to access the Maintain Worktag Balancing Configuration task to correct this.
validation.description: The combination of cost center and company is not allowed for unapplied and on-account payments. Ask your Finance Administrator to access the Maintain Worktag Balancing Configuration task to correct this

validation.validation: Payment Type must be valid for Bank Account entered.
validation.description: Payment Type must be valid for Bank Account entered.

validation.validation: You're trying to submit 1 or more payments that are in draft status and no longer valid for this deposit. Exclude those payments and submit again.
validation.description: You're trying to submit 1 or more payments that are in draft status and no longer valid for this deposit. Exclude those payments and submit again.

validation.validation: The currency you're specifying for this deposit must match the currency of the payments.
validation.description: The currency you're specifying for this deposit must match the currency of the payments.

validation.validation: To submit this deposit, only specify payments that have the same currency as the deposit.
validation.description: To submit this deposit, only specify payments that have the same currency as the deposit.
